glsa.title: nettle: Information disclosure
glsa.synopsis: A cache-related side channel vulnerability was found in nettle which might allow an attacker to obtain sensitive information.

background.p: Nettle is a cryptographic library that is designed to fit easily in almost any context: In cryptographic toolkits for object-oriented languages, such as C++, Python, or Pike, in applications like lsh or GnuPG, or even in kernel space.

description.p: It was found that nettle’s RSA and DSA decryption code was vulnerable to cache-related side channel attacks.
See the referenced technical paper “Cache Attacks Enable Bulk Key Recovery on the Cloud” below for details.

impact.p: An attacker could recover the private key from a co-located virtual-machine instance.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All nettle users should upgrade to the latest version:

references.uri: Cache Attacks Enable Bulk Key Recovery on the Cloud
